thread.title: Heart Institute researchers funded to pursue projects on atherosclerosis, acute cardiac events and open science | University of Ottawa Heart Institute

title: Heart Institute researchers funded to pursue projects on atherosclerosis, acute cardiac events and open science | University of Ottawa Heart Institute
text:
Ottawa, November 7, 2024 - The Heart & Stroke Foundation of Canada (Heart & Stroke) has awarded three researchers from the University of Ottawa Heart Institute with project funding available through the organizationâ€™s Grant-in-Aid Program.
The Grant-in-Aid Program provides operating funds to support important, pertinent, novel research in the areas of heart disease and stroke.
Congratulations to all our researchers!
Principal investigator: [Kelly Cobey, PhD](/profile/cobey-kelly)
Project: Implementing Open Science in the Cardiovascular Research Community
Funding: $261,235 over three years
Principal investigator: [Mireille Ouimet, PhD](/profile/ouimet-mireille)
Project: Enhancing Lipophagy to Reverse Atherosclerosis
Funding: $289,057 over three years
Principal investigator: [Heather Tulloch, PhD](/profile/tulloch-heather)
Project: Survey of Life After an Acute Cardiac Event: SOLACE Study
Funding: $267,251 over three years
Learn more about [Heart & Stroke grant programs for researchers](https://www.heartandstroke.ca/what-we-do/research/for-researchers), including the Grant-in-Aid Program.
To coordinate an interview with any of the recipients listed above, please contact the media liaison below.
Media contact
Leigh B. Morris
Communications Officer
University of Ottawa Heart Institute
613-316-6409 (cell)[lmorris@ottawaheart.ca](#)
